00031 //
00032 //      mv_matrix.h  : basic templated numerical matrix class, storage
00033 //                  by columns (Fortran oriented.)

00035 //

00039 #ifndef _MV_MATRIX_TYPE_H_
00040 #define _MV_MATRIX_TYPE_H_

00042 #include "mv_vector_TYPE.h"
00043 #include "mv_matrix_ref.h"

00045 
00046 
00047 #include <sstream>
00048        // for formatted printing of matrices
00049 #ifdef MV_MATRIX_BOUNDS_CHECK
00050 #   include <assert.h>
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 
00054 class MV_ColMat_TYPE
00055 {                                                                      
00056     private:                                                           
00057            MV_Vector_TYPE v_;
00058            int dim0_;   // perferred to using dim_[2]. some compilers
00059            int dim1_;   // refuse to initalize these in the constructor.
00060            int lda_;
00061            int ref_;   // true if this is declared as a reference vector,
00062                         // i.e. it does not own the memory space, but 
00063                         // rather it is a view to another vector or array.
00064     public:                                                            
00065                                                                        
00066         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                                 
00067         /* Constructors/Destructors */                                 
00068         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                                 
00069                                                                        
00070             MV_ColMat_TYPE();                             
00071             MV_ColMat_TYPE(unsigned int, unsigned int); 
00072 
00073     // some compilers have difficulty with inlined 'for' statements.
00074     MV_ColMat_TYPE(unsigned int, unsigned int, const TYPE&);   
00075 
00076     // usual copy by value
00077     // (can't use default parameter lda=m, because m is not a constant...)
00078     //
00079     MV_ColMat_TYPE(TYPE*, unsigned int m, unsigned int n);
00080     MV_ColMat_TYPE(TYPE*, unsigned int m, unsigned int n, unsigned int lda);
00081 
00082     // the "reference" versions
00083     //
00084     //
00085     MV_ColMat_TYPE(TYPE*, unsigned int m, unsigned int n, MV_Matrix_::ref_type i);
00086     MV_ColMat_TYPE(TYPE*, unsigned int m, unsigned int n, unsigned int lda,
00087                 MV_Matrix_::ref_type i);
00088 
00089     MV_ColMat_TYPE(const MV_ColMat_TYPE&); 
00090     ~MV_ColMat_TYPE();                              
00091                                                                        
00092         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                           
00093         /*  Indices and access operations */                           
00094         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                           
00095                                                                        
00096     inline TYPE&        operator()(unsigned int, unsigned int); 
00097     inline const TYPE&  operator()(unsigned int, unsigned int) const; 
00098     MV_ColMat_TYPE operator()(const MV_VecIndex &I, const MV_VecIndex &J) ;
00099     const MV_ColMat_TYPE operator()(const MV_VecIndex &I, const MV_VecIndex &J) const;
00100     unsigned int            size(int i) const; 
00101     MV_ColMat_TYPE&         newsize(unsigned int, unsigned int);
00102     int ref() const { return ref_;}
00103                                                                        
00104         /*::::::::::::::*/                                             
00105         /*  Assignment  */                                             
00106         /*::::::::::::::*/                                             
00107                                                                        
00108     MV_ColMat_TYPE & operator=(const MV_ColMat_TYPE&);
00109     MV_ColMat_TYPE & operator=(const TYPE&);
00110 
00111 
00112     friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream &s, const MV_ColMat_TYPE &A);
00113 
00114 };                                                                     
00115 
00116 inline TYPE& MV_ColMat_TYPE::operator()(unsigned int i, unsigned int j)
00117 {
00118 #ifdef MV_MATRIX_BOUNDS_CHECK
00119     assert(0<=i && i<size(0));
00120     assert(0<=j && j<size(1));
00121 #endif
00122     return v_(j*lda_ + i);      // could use indirect addressing
00123                                 // instead...
00124 }
00125 
00126 inline const TYPE& MV_ColMat_TYPE::operator()
00127                     (unsigned int i, unsigned int j) const
00128 {
00129 #ifdef MV_MATRIX_BOUNDS_CHECK
00130     assert(0<=i && i<size(0));
00131     assert(0<=j && j<size(1));
00132 #endif
00133     return v_(j*lda_ + i);
00134 }
00135 
00136 inline MV_ColMat_TYPE::MV_ColMat_TYPE(TYPE* d, unsigned int m, unsigned int n,
00137         MV_Matrix_::ref_type i ):
00138             v_(d,m*n, MV_Vector_::ref), dim0_(m), dim1_(n), lda_(m), ref_(i) {}
00139  
00140 inline MV_ColMat_TYPE::MV_ColMat_TYPE(TYPE* d, unsigned int m, unsigned int n,
00141             unsigned int lda, MV_Matrix_::ref_type i) :
00142             v_(d, lda*n, MV_Vector_::ref), dim0_(m), dim1_(n), lda_(lda),
00143             ref_(i) {}
00144 
00145 #endif
